content:
• Monday, October 31, 2011
  • HLF

    More on Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q3 easily beats estimates on a 30% Y/Y jump in net sales and...

    More on Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q3 easily beats estimates on a 30% Y/Y jump in net sales and record volume growth. However, the company issues cautious guidance for FY11, citing the volatility of foreign currency exchange rates for many of its key markets. Shares -2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM
  • SIFY

    Indian tech stocks Sify Technologies (SIFY +62.8%) and Rediff (REDF +44%) opened lower today,...

    Indian tech stocks Sify Technologies (SIFY +62.8%) and Rediff (REDF +44%) opened lower today, but were the day's biggest winners by the time trading ended. The companies posted more modest gains on Friday after delivering their Q3 reports (I, II); today's moves are more likely the result of buyout speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • EXEL

    Exelixis (NASDAQ:EXEL) resumes trading after a long halt, now down 33.4% AH, after announcing...

    Exelixis (NASDAQ:EXEL) resumes trading after a long halt, now down 33.4% AH, after announcing it's initiating its first phase 3 trial of cabozantinib for patients with a particular type of prostate cancer. Without an agreement with the FDA, the company's not pursuing a special protocol assessment from the agency.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) gains 9.4% AH after posting Q3 results. While revenue of $763.3M (+20% Y/Y)...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) gains 9.4% AH after posting Q3 results. While revenue of $763.3M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.90 missed by $0.3M and $0.17, Leap's subscriber numbers - net gain of 73K voice subs, net loss of broadband subs, 3.8% churn - were better than Q2's figures. In addition, Leap reported free cash flow of $165M, much better than Q2's -$170M. Â 

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • AVB

    AvalonBay Communities (NYSE:AVB): Q3 FFO of $1.17 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $253M (+11.2% Y/Y)...

    AvalonBay Communities (NYSE:AVB): Q3 FFO of $1.17 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $253M (+11.2% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Expects Q4 FFO of $1.19-$1.23, vs. expected $1.28. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SBAC

    SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC): Q3 EPS of -$0.30 misses by $.07. Revenue of $175.5M (+11% Y/Y)...

    SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC): Q3 EPS of -$0.30 misses by $.07. Revenue of $175.5M (+11% Y/Y) misses by $2M. Company expects Q4 revenue of $182M-$186M vs. $184.1M consensus. Expects 2012 revenue of $785M-$810M vs. $770.2M consensus. SBAC +0.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MGIC

    Magic Software Enterprises (MGIC +2.8%) moves higher after acquiring BluePhoenix Solutions'...

    Magic Software Enterprises (MGIC +2.8%) moves higher after acquiring BluePhoenix Solutions' (BPHX +5%) AppBuilder for $17M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • MFGLQ

    Private equity firm J.C. Flowers could record a $47.8M loss on account of its stake in MF Global...

    Private equity firm J.C. Flowers could record a $47.8M loss on account of its stake in MF Global (MF), according to Bloomberg TV. Jefferies (JEF -7.8%) says its exposure to MF Global amounts to less than $9M, but shares are nonetheless falling hard today. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • QTRH

    Wi-LAN (WILN +8%) is higher today after the company says it won't increase its $42 per share...

    Wi-LAN (WILN +8%) is higher today after the company says it won't increase its $42 per share offer to acquire MOSAID Technologies (OTC:MBTHF). The offer will expire at 5:00 pm Eastern time on November 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com (OSTK -7.6%), hammered last week after a weak Q3 report, is off sharply again...

    Overstock.com (OSTK -7.6%), hammered last week after a weak Q3 report, is off sharply again today after long-time bear Sam Antar claims the online retailer's debt obligations are much more significant than its balance sheet might indicate at first glance, and could lead the firm to default. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • ITT

    ITT (ITT +3.5%) completes the previously announced spin off of its Defense and Information...

    ITT (ITT +3.5%) completes the previously announced spin off of its Defense and Information Solutions business and its Water Technology and Services business. With the spin offs complete, ITT transitions into $2B company with four businesses that will focus on the industrial, aerospace, transportation, and oil and gas industries.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • NPBC

    National Penn Bancshares (NPBC -4.9%) trades down after Janney lowers its rating to Neutral,...

    National Penn Bancshares (NPBC -4.9%) trades down after Janney lowers its rating to Neutral, saying yields are flattening and the Pennsylvania economy remains sluggish.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • OCR

    Omnicare (OCR +2.9%) trades up after Barclays ups the shares to Equalweight, citing better...

    Omnicare (OCR +2.9%) trades up after Barclays ups the shares to Equalweight, citing better earnings visibility following its Q3 report last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • AXL

    Shares of American Axle (AXL +2.9%) move higher today, adding to a 46% run since hitting its...

    Shares of American Axle (AXL +2.9%) move higher today, adding to a 46% run since hitting its lows earlier this month. Credit Suisse raises its price target on the shares, saying its Q3 reported on Friday showed a better than expected top-line and solid backlog of business.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • UQM

    Electric car components maker UQM Technologies (UQM +9%) ramps higher after Needham ups the...

    Electric car components maker UQM Technologies (UQM +9%) ramps higher after Needham ups the shares to Buy from Hold. The firm cites an increase in production of electric motors for Coda Automotive and growth initiatives at Audi and Electric Vehicles International.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT -1.8%) trades lower after the company said late Friday that it sees no advantage...

    Medtronic (MDT -1.8%) trades lower after the company said late Friday that it sees no advantage in spinning off its spine business, a division that has weighed on growth for some time.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK -3.7%) sells off after Sterne Agee downgrades the flash memory vendor to Neutral,...

    SanDisk (SNDK -3.7%) sells off after Sterne Agee downgrades the flash memory vendor to Neutral, arguing shares "bake in most of the upside" from near-term NAND flash demand and hard drive shortages, thanks to a 65% run over the last two months. The firms adds seasonal pricing trends also aren't favorable to SanDisk.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA -3.2%) dips after the U.S. Supreme Court says it won't consider its...

    Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA -3.2%) dips after the U.S. Supreme Court says it won't consider its challenge to Merck's (MRK -0.4%) patent for the brain-cancer drug Temodar.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • TREX

    Building materials provider Trex (NYSE:TREX) is up 14.8% after reporting Q3 results. While...

    Building materials provider Trex (NYSE:TREX) is up 14.8% after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $67.9M (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.03 missed consensus by $1.5M and $0.02, and expected Q4 revenue of $50M-$55M is well below a $70M consensus, Trex says it expects Q1 2012 revenue to be up 25% Y/Y, and overall 2012 sales to "grow significantly."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM

  • Arch Coal (ACI -6.9% ) gets hit after CLSA cut the shares to Underperform on the back of its...

    Arch Coal (ACI -6.9% ) gets hit after CLSA cut the shares to Underperform on the back of its earnings miss on Friday. The firm says fundamentals for the coals sector are still strong, but there are better alternatives to hold in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • ANTM

    Amerigroup (AGP +2%) bucks the downtrend today after Goldman upgrades the stock to Buy. The firm...

    Amerigroup (AGP +2%) bucks the downtrend today after Goldman upgrades the stock to Buy. The firm says concerns that the company's Q3 results would suffer a margin crunch have passed, and it's now focused on the "very strong growth opportunity" over the next few years as states convert spending to managed care.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • HOV

    Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -2%) dips as stock price action gives a lukewarm response to its...

    Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -2%) dips as stock price action gives a lukewarm response to its extended and sweetened debt exchange offer to holders of bonds that come due in 2014 and 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • PXD

    Sterne Agee issues a cautious warning for five oil names due to report earnings over the next...

    Sterne Agee issues a cautious warning for five oil names due to report earnings over the next couple of days. The firm says that if hurdle rates miss in either production or costs, it's likely to create volatile price action: Pioneer Natural Resources Co. (PXD -4.7%), EOG Resources (EOG -5%), Whiting Petroleum (WLL -6.4%), Denbury Resources (DNR -5.9%) and Approach Resources (AREX -5%%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic (WFR -9%) gets slammed by overall weakness in solar shares today, plus a...

    MEMC Electronic (WFR -9%) gets slammed by overall weakness in solar shares today, plus a downgrade to Hold by Auriga. The firm cites selling price weakness which largely offsets the silicon wafer maker's cost advantage over its peers, plus expectations that the company will cut guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • STP

    Lots of bad news for solar stocks: The U.K. government proposes a reduction of as much as 55%...

    Lots of bad news for solar stocks: The U.K. government proposes a reduction of as much as 55% for the price paid for solar power; Suntech Power (STP -10.8%) says it may reduce some of its manufacturing output early next year because of a seasonal dip in demand; and Merrill Lynch cuts its rating on First Solar (FSLR -8.1%) after at least seven downgrades last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • HAE

    Medical device manufacturer Haemonetics (HAE -3.5%) gets hit after its FQ2 misses EPS estimates,...

    Medical device manufacturer Haemonetics (HAE -3.5%) gets hit after its FQ2 misses EPS estimates, despite beating on revenue. Profits rose 8% Y/Y, but net income declined 35% due to quality issues with its HS Core Bowl and the recall of its OrthoPAT device.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • VLO

    Oil refiners are trading lower today, but Valero (VLO -8.5%) is falling harder than most, after...

    Oil refiners are trading lower today, but Valero (VLO -8.5%) is falling harder than most, after India's Reliance says it isn't interested in buying the company. Reliance, Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A), and other oil giants have been rumored to be weighing bids for Valero.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • BWP

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP -2.30%) dips after its Q3 profit fell 15% on diminished parking...

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP -2.30%) dips after its Q3 profit fell 15% on diminished parking and lending revenue and higher expenses, though the larger gas transportation segment saw revenue grow.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum Communications (SPRD +2.2%) breaks out again today, hitting another 52-week high...

    Spreadtrum Communications (SPRD +2.2%) breaks out again today, hitting another 52-week high after announcing late last week that it was purchasing an 8.3% stake in Zoom Technologies (ZOOM -3.3%). The stock has been on fire over the past few weeks, soaring over 60% since the beginning of October.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +0.8%) is outperforming after R.W. Baird says its checks show Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) is...

    Apple (AAPL +0.8%) is outperforming after R.W. Baird says its checks show Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) is sold out of the iPhone 4S at "the vast majority" of locations. In addition, UBS is joining in on speculation that China Telecom (NYSE:CHA), which added 9M subscribers in Q3, will soon offer the iPhone for its EV-DO 3G network.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire (CTB +1.5%) snaps back after plunging 9.3% at the open following a mixed Q3 earnings...

    Cooper Tire (CTB +1.5%) snaps back after plunging 9.3% at the open following a mixed Q3 earnings report earlier. The company reported an EPS of $0.27 on sales of $1.05B, which beat analysts estimates on revenue but missed on a per share basis. Overall earnings dropped 61% Y/Y as weak sales growth couldn't offset higher material costs. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • BGS

    Shares of B&G Foods (BGS +6.9%) gain after the firm announces a deal to acquire six Culver...

    Shares of B&G Foods (BGS +6.9%) gain after the firm announces a deal to acquire six Culver specialty brands from Unilever (UL -0.5%) for $325M. The company expects the acquisition to be immediately accretive to earnings and free cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • SHAW

    After falling premarket on a Q3 miss and soft FY12 guidance (expected EPS of $2.00-$2.10 vs....

    After falling premarket on a Q3 miss and soft FY12 guidance (expected EPS of $2.00-$2.10 vs. $2.25 consensus), Shaw Group (SHAW +5.5%) has reversed course. The company's remarks about "evaluating strategic alternatives" for its struggling Energy & Chemicals division could be giving shares a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMSC

    Wind turbine parts maker AMSC (AMSC -2.3%) trades lower after the company terminates its $265M...

    Wind turbine parts maker AMSC (AMSC -2.3%) trades lower after the company terminates its $265M acquisition agreement for Finnish peer The Switch Engineering Oy, citing adverse market conditions for financing the deal. The collapse of the deal is the latest in a series of setbacks for the company, having earlier faced contractual issues with its largest customer, China-based Sinovel Wind Group, who failed to pay for its deliveries over two quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP -34.9%) sinks after the company reports "adverse events" in a trial of...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP -34.9%) sinks after the company reports "adverse events" in a trial of its experimental short bowel syndrome therapy - Gattex - including two patients dying from cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • DWA

    DreamWorks' (DWA -8.1%) latest film, Puss in Boots, wins the weekend box office but loses Wall...

    DreamWorks' (DWA -8.1%) latest film, Puss in Boots, wins the weekend box office but loses Wall Street's confidence. The film earned $34M in the U.S., well below the $47.8M expected by Janney, where analyst Tony Wilbe says the opening implies the Shrek franchise "is completely out of momentum, which will increase pressure on DWA to find new franchises."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • EDMC

    Education Management (EDMC +5.12%) bucks a weak tape and slogs higher today after its board of...

    Education Management (EDMC +5.12%) bucks a weak tape and slogs higher today after its board of directors extends the deadline for its $325M stock buyback program from Dec. 31 to June 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +20.3%) takes off after announcing the temporary restraining order...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +20.3%) takes off after announcing the temporary restraining order it previously won against Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -2.7%) and two other drug vendors regarding the sale of a generic version of its Lovenox drug has turned into a preliminary injunction. No trial date for the dispute has been set.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • BALT

    Baltic Trading (BALT -5.5%) dips after FBR Capital cut the shares to Market Perform, citing...

    Baltic Trading (BALT -5.5%) dips after FBR Capital cut the shares to Market Perform, citing challenges to its FY12 outlook due to a difficult dry-bulk shipping market.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • ORIT

    Oritani Financial (ORIT -5.1%) is trading down this morning after both Sandler O'Neill and...

    Oritani Financial (ORIT -5.1%) is trading down this morning after both Sandler O'Neill and Sterne Agee downgrade the shares to Neutral on valuation. The stock has had a healthy run this year, racking up a 33% gain over the past 52 weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • IART

    Medical device maker Integra LifeSciences (IART -6.2%) sells off after reporting Q3 revenue of...

    Medical device maker Integra LifeSciences (IART -6.2%) sells off after reporting Q3 revenue of $202.2M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.77; the latter was in-line, but the former missed by $1.95M. Integra, which says it's facing a "challenging selling environment," is also lowering its 2011 EPS guidance range to $2.88-$2.96, from a prior range of $2.92-$3.02.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • PCRX

    Shares of Pacira Pharmaceuticals (PCRX +3.7%) jump after the FDA approves its Exparel treatment...

    Shares of Pacira Pharmaceuticals (PCRX +3.7%) jump after the FDA approves its Exparel treatment for post-surgical pain. The approval may help limit the use of opioids, painkillers that also are powerful narcotics that can be addictive, in treatment after surgery.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • CYOU

    Chinese online game developer Changyou.com (CYOU -18%) crashes after reporting Q3 results. While...

    Chinese online game developer Changyou.com (CYOU -18%) crashes after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $119M (+39% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.01 beat by $1.5M and $0.02, the company's in-line Q4 guidance (revenue of $122M-$125M and EPS of $1.09-$1.12 vs. consensus of $123.1M and $1.10) isn't sitting well with investors. Rival GAME is down 6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • HUM

    Shares of Humana (NYSE:HUM) gain 5.3% after beating estimates for Q3 earnings on the strength of...

    Shares of Humana (NYSE:HUM) gain 5.3% after beating estimates for Q3 earnings on the strength of strong Medicare memberships and an extended slowdown in patients using healthcare services. The company sees EPSÂ for FY11 and FY12 of $7.50-$7.60 and $7.40-$7.60, respectively, boosted by lower projected benefit expense ratios in the company’s Retail and Employer Group Segments and more gains in Medicare memberships.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • MFGLQ

    As MF Global (MF) unravels (I, II), it looks like CEO Jon Corzine could take much of the heat....

    As MF Global (MF) unravels (I, II), it looks like CEO Jon Corzine could take much of the heat. The WSJ notes Corzine "started making big bets" on the sovereign debt of at-risk eurozone countries in late 2010, and that the former NJ governor often "placed orders himself based on a list of prices left with an assistant."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • JBLU

    Shares of JetBlue (NASDAQ:JBLU) fall 3.9% in premarket trading - losing more ground than other...

    Shares of JetBlue (NASDAQ:JBLU) fall 3.9% in premarket trading - losing more ground than other airline stocks - after a weekend snowstorm stranded a number of the carrier's flights on the tarmac for delays of up to seven hours.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • MNTA

    Premarket gainers: MNTA +17%. PCRX +7%. NBR +5%. HRBN +4%. CP +4%.Losers: HMC -8%. DB -7%. MTW...

    Premarket gainers: MNTA +17%. PCRX +7%. NBR +5%. HRBN +4%. CP +4%.
    Losers: HMC -8%. DB -7%. MTW -6%. DANG -5%. ING -5%. RBS -5%. FRO -5%. RIO -4%. BHP -4%. TTM -4%. FBR -4%. DRYS -4%. LYG -4%. TCL-OLD -4%. UBS -4%. AEG -4%. PCX -3%. NBG -3%. MS -3%. STO -3%. FCX -3%. YGE -3%. RENN -3%. X -3%. YHOO -3%. ASML -3%. BAC -3%. NTT -3%. VALE -3%. ALU -3%. C -3%. GCB -3%. MGM -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • SOHU

    Sohu (NASDAQ:SOHU) is down 7.3% after posting Q3 results. Though the Chinese online gaming and...

    Sohu (NASDAQ:SOHU) is down 7.3% after posting Q3 results. Though the Chinese online gaming and search firm delivered healthy Q4 guidance - expected revenue of $241M-$246M and EPS of $1.30-$1.35 is above a consensus of $235.8M and $1.25 - investors seem to be focusing on Sohu's Q3 EPS miss, given how it breaks a string of earnings beats. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) slips 3.3% lower in premarket trading after reports tip toward the company selling...

    Yahoo (YHOO) slips 3.3% lower in premarket trading after reports tip toward the company selling off Asian assets and paying a dividend, instead of selling itself.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) gains 2% after Piper issues a bullish note ahead of the company's...

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) gains 2% after Piper issues a bullish note ahead of the company's Tuesday Q3 report. Piper's checks suggest accelerating adoption of IPG's fiber lasers in the industrial laser market, as they continue displacing legacy technologies. The firm adds it sees "potential for upside to [EPS] guidance," due to both revenue growth and operating leverage.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM

  • The dollar settles in +3.1% vs. the yen at ¥78.19 following last night's intervention by...

    The dollar settles in +3.1% vs. the yen at Â¥78.19 following last night's intervention by Japan. "Massive... that's the only way to describe it," says a trader of the estimated $130B intervention. Japanese shares were unimpressed, closing -0.7% after an initial 2% spike higher on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM

  • Global stocks may have soared last week on the eurozone debt deal but Italian bonds continue...

    Global stocks may have soared last week on the eurozone debt deal but Italian bonds continue taking a pounding after Friday's expensive government auction, with 5-year yields today hitting a euro-era record of 5.99% and 10-year yields rising to 6.18%. Back in August, the yield hit 6.26% before the ECB stepped in.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • MNTA

    Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) move 16% higher premarket after the company...

    Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) move 16% higher premarket after the company announces it obtained a preliminary injunction against a number of biotech rivals from offering or selling their own generic Lovenox treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • NBR

    As part of giving up the CEO post at Nabors (NYSE:NBR), Eugene Isenberg is getting $100M cash -...

    As part of giving up the CEO post at Nabors (NYSE:NBR), Eugene Isenberg is getting $100M cash - more than the company's Q3 net income. The unusual clause isn't quite severance, since he's staying on as chairman, but it is one of the biggest executive payouts in years. NBR +1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 1 Comment
